topic: Feature completeness threshold: ship with 8/10 criteria or wait for 10/10

claims: 8 of 10 acceptance criteria are met; the missing two are (a) keyboard shortcuts and (b) CSV export.
Keyboard shortcuts are a nice-to-have; no user has requested them in beta feedback.
CSV export was requested by 3 enterprise beta users and is in the sales deck.
The release deadline is next Wednesday; completing both criteria would push to the following week.
Shipping without CSV export risks disappointing the 3 enterprise prospects.
open_questions: Can CSV export be shipped as a fast-follow within 3 days of launch?
Are the 3 enterprise prospects in active deal cycles or early pipeline?
Is there a workaround (e.g., copy-paste from the table) that covers the gap?
next_actions: Estimate effort for CSV export as a standalone PR.
Check enterprise deal stage with sales.
outputs.summary: Keyboard shortcuts can be deferred. CSV export is the real question â€” it has sales implications. Need deal-stage data.

claims: 8 of 10 acceptance criteria are met; the missing two are (a) keyboard shortcuts and (b) CSV export.
CSV export was requested by 3 enterprise beta users and is in the sales deck.
CSV export is a 2-day effort; shipping it as a fast-follow means it lands 2 days after launch.
Two of the 3 enterprise prospects are in late-stage deal cycles (contracts expected within 2 weeks).
A copy-paste workaround exists but is not viable for large datasets (>1000 rows).
decisions: Ship on Wednesday without CSV export.
Ship CSV export as a fast-follow by Friday.
Defer keyboard shortcuts to the next release cycle.
open_questions: Should we notify the 2 late-stage prospects about the fast-follow timeline?
next_actions: Create a follow-up ticket for CSV export (due Friday).
Draft a message to enterprise prospects about the timeline.
outputs.summary: Ship Wednesday with 8/10, fast-follow CSV by Friday. Keyboard shortcuts deferred. One communication question remains.

claims: CSV export is a 2-day effort; shipping it as a fast-follow means it lands 2 days after launch.
Two of the 3 enterprise prospects are in late-stage deal cycles (contracts expected within 2 weeks).
Proactively notifying prospects about the fast-follow timeline is better than letting them discover the gap.
decisions: Ship on Wednesday without CSV export.
Ship CSV export as a fast-follow by Friday.
Notify the 2 late-stage prospects with a timeline.
outputs.summary: Plan is complete. Ship Wednesday, CSV by Friday, notify prospects. All questions resolved.

claims: Proactively notifying prospects about the fast-follow timeline is better than letting them discover the gap.
CSV export is a 2-day effort; shipping it as a fast-follow means it lands 2 days after launch.

diminishing_returns_note.rationale: Round 3 closes the last open question (prospect notification) and the plan is fully executable. Round 4 is restatement.

_expected.reason: Decision made with concrete fast-follow plan, risk mitigation (prospect notification), and clear next actions. Classic ship-vs-polish convergence.
